content: the juniper berry shawl features a lovely undulating lace pattern at a loose gauge the result is a large and cozy accessory to hug your shoulders whenever there is a chill in the air worked up in self-shading colorburst this pattern is a joy to knit as you watch the colors change from one to the next this design is truly a one-skein wonder this shawl is knit flat from the top-down you may wish to place stitch markers between each pattern repeat to help you stay on track juniper berry shawl designed by rachel brockman **sizes** one size **finished measurements** wingspan 68½ depth at center 34¼ **materials** **universal yarn** * colorburst 1 * 65% superwash fine merino 35% acrylic 200g/660 yds 103 aries 1 ball needles us size 8 5 mm 32 circular or longer to accommodate large number of sts or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle stitch markers **gauge** 16 sts x 18 row = 4 in lace patt save time check your gauge 1 https //universalyarn com/collections/yarn/products/colorb
